ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Go to Pharaoh; he has overstepped the bounds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then go to the Pharaoh as he has become exceedingly rebellious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Go both of you to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed all bounds,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Go both of you to the Pharaoh; he has become a rebel.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Both of you go to Firaun; he has indeed rebelled.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Go both of you to Fir`awn, verily, he has transgressed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Go both to Firon, surely he has become inordinate;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Go to Pharaoh, for he has waxed insolent;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Go, both of you, unto Pharaoh. Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Go, both of you to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed all bounds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Go ye twain unto Fir'awn, verily he hath waxen exorbitant,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Both of you go to Pharaoh, for he has indeed rebelled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Go, both of you, to Fir'aun (Pharaoh), verily, he has transgressed (all bounds in disbelief and disobedience and behaved as an arrogant and as a tyrant).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Go to Pharaoh, for he has become insolent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Go to Pharaoh. He has tyrannized.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:43] Go the two of you to Pharaoh. Truly he has transgressed [the bounds], in claiming to be the Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Go, both of you, unto Pharaoh. Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds)) he has become arrogant, overweening and a disbeliever.
